intro: Matelea graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Matelea graciliflora is typically found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and stream banks.
